content.question: Two boats cross a river that has a current of velocity <math alttext="v sub r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>r</mi></msub></math>, as shown. The boats have identical speeds with respect to the water. Boat <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> heads at an angle upstream such that it reaches the opposite shore directly across from its starting point. Boat <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> heads in a direction perpendicular to the current and reaches a position on the opposite shore downstream of its starting point. Which boat takes less time to cross the river, and what reasoning supports this claim?

choices.label: Boat <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> takes less time because it travels a shorter distance than Boat <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

Boat <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> takes less time because its velocity with respect to the water and the current velocity add together, giving Boat <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> a greater resultant velocity.

Boat <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> takes less time because its velocity has a greater <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-component with respect to the ground than Boat <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
Boat <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> takes less time because the current increases the boatâ€™s speed relative to the ground.

content.answer: Boat <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> takes less time because its velocity has a greater <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-component with respect to the ground than Boat <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
